title: At least seven killed, dozens missing after 6.7 magnitude quake hits Japan

json.text:
Over in Japan, a powerful earthquake hit Hokkaido
early Thursday.

According to the country's news outlets...
the natural disaster took at least 7 lives
and left dozens missing.
Ko Roon-hee bring us the updates.

At least seven people have been killed and
more than 2-hundred people have been injured

after a powerful earthquake struck the Japanese
island of Hokkaido early Thursday morning.

The magnitude 6-point-7 quake triggered landslides…
and there have been dozens of aftershocks.

According to the Japan Meteorological Agency,
the tremor struck just 65 kilometers southeast
of the city of Sapporo at a depth of 40 kilometers.

Japanese broadcaster NHK reported that helicopter
crews are carrying out rescue operations…but
dozens are still missing.

The quake also caused an entire blackout in
the area,… leaving millions without power.

Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the Japanese
government has set an emergency task force…and

25-thousand Self-Defense Force personnel will
be sent to the region.

"I have received damage reports from this
earthquake, there have been possible fatalities,

landslides, collapsed buildings, and a large
scale blackout.

Saving people's lives is the government's
utmost priority and we will deal with the
disaster relief collectively.
We will manage this crisis as best we can."

The quake comes after another deadly disaster,
Typhoon Jebi, which struck the Kansai region

in the west of the country earlier in the
week.

Japan's most powerful typhoon in 25 years
left at least 11 people dead.

Thousands were left stranded at Kansai International
Airport due to flooding... with passengers
now being moved to another nearby airport.

Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on
Thursday that Kansai Airport will partially

resume operations by the end of Friday...and
added that international flights will restart
as soon as they are ready.
Ko Roon-hee, Arirang News.
